metadata.title: CVE-2020-16119 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel exploitable by a localattacker due to reuse of a DCCP socket with an attached dccps_hc_tx_ccidobject as a listener after being released. Fixed in Ubuntu Linux kernel5.4.0-51.56, 5.3.0-68.63, 4.15.0-121.123, 4.4.0-193.224, 3.13.0.182.191 and3.2.0-149.196.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
